channel.title: She Reads Truth Podcast
channel.itunes:author: She Reads Truth
channel.description: We know reading the Bible every day can be hard. It’s easy to feel stuck, lost, or unsure where to start. We get it. We’ve been there too. Our hope for this podcast is that it will serve as a complement to our reading plans, to encourage you on your commute to work, while you’re out for a walk, or at home making dinner. God’s Word is for you and for now. That's why our community is here and always open to you.
channel.itunes:keywords: She Reads Truth, Bible, Jesus, Christian, Christianity, Bible Reading, women, motivational

item.itunes:title: Hebrews Week 3 with Patti Sauls
item.title: Hebrews Week 3 with Patti Sauls
item.description:
Welcome to the third and final week of Hebrews with Raechel and Amanda,who are joined by She Reads Truth devotional writer Patti Sauls. As they read through the last chapters of the reading plan, they discuss the author’s encouragement to hold on to the hope of the gospel, no matter what. Join them as they reflect on the joys and struggles of living out our faith in this present world as we wait for the return of our Savior. 



Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Hebrews reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Hebrews collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/hebrews-week-3-with-patti-sauls

item.itunes:title: Hebrews Week 2 with Kelly Minter
item.title: Hebrews Week 2 with Kelly Minter
item.description:
Join us for the second week of Hebrews as Raechel and Amanda are joined by author, Bible teacher, and podcaster, Kelly Minter. From high theological concepts to moments of immense specificity, the book of Hebrews constantly points to the superiority of Jesus. Exploring this superiority through the daily readings, Raechel, Amanda, and Kelly remind us of what we can know with full assurance—because Jesus is superior, His life alone is the only sufficient sacrifice.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Hebrews reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Hebrews collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/hebrews-week-2-with-kelly-minter

item.itunes:title: Hebrews Week 1 with John Onwuchekwa
item.title: Hebrews Week 1 with John Onwuchekwa
item.description:
You don’t want to miss Week 1 of Hebrews with Amanda and Raechel who are joined by pastor, author, and entrepreneur, John Onwuchekwa. The three dive into the opening chapters of this New Testament book, reflecting on the richness of what it means to have a God who speaks to us and seeks a relationship with us. Join us for this encouraging and authentic conversation as we begin our study of Hebrews together. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Hebrews reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Hebrews collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Leviticus Week 3 with Rachel Jones
item.title: Leviticus Week 3 with Rachel Jones
item.description:
Listen in this week as Raechel and Amanda close out the final week of Leviticus with Rachel Jones, author and vice president of editorial at The Good Book Company. In this episode, Raechel, Amanda, and Rachel further discuss how Leviticus reminds us that God is both holy and set apart, and that He is faithful in providing a way for people to enter His presence. Join us as they discuss how God’s Word invites us to not only be holy in our behavior, but also with our time.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Leviticus reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Leviticus collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com/collections/Leviticus. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/leviticus-week-3-with-rachel-jones

item.itunes:title: Leviticus Week 2 with Phylicia Masonheimer
item.title: Leviticus Week 2 with Phylicia Masonheimer
item.description:
For Week 2 of Leviticus, Raechel and Amanda are joined by author and Bible teacher, Phylicia Masonheimer. You don’t want to miss their discussion about how this section of Leviticus continually points us to God’s kindness and mercy in making a way for broken people to be near to Him. Join us in reflecting on how relevant God’s working all the way back in Leviticus is for us today. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Leviticus reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Bonus Episode: Advent 2022 Is Here!
item.title: Bonus Episode: Advent 2022 Is Here!
item.description:
Join Raechel and Amanda for a bonus podcast episode to celebrate the launch of She Reads Truth’s Advent 2022 collection. What is Advent? Why do we celebrate it? How can you join the She Reads Truth community in reading Scripture every day this Advent season? Join us for this exciting episode as we answer these questions and begin to prepare for the Advent season together! 


Shop the Advent 2022 collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com/collections/advent-2022. 


Sign up for the She Reads Truth subscription box and we’ll send you our newest study book every month so you never have to wonder what to read next.Visit ShopSheReadsTruth.com/subbox and get the monthly subscription box today!

While you are shopping, sign up for our text message program at ShopSheReadsTruth.com — you’ll get early bird access to our biggest deals, restock alerts, and special offers!

item.itunes:title: Leviticus Week 1 with Wendell & Devaney Cole
item.title: Leviticus Week 1 with Wendell & Devaney Cole
item.description:
Welcome to the first week of our Leviticus reading plan! This week, Raechel and Amanda are joined by Wendell and Devaney Cole. Wendell currently serves as a pastor, and Devaney is a clinical scientist. Providing a framework for approaching the book of Leviticus, this episode reminds us of the role of Leviticus in the grand narrative of Scripture. Throughout the episode you’ll find helpful notes to consider as you seek to read and understand Leviticus, a book highlighting a holy God who established a way to dwell among His sinful people. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Leviticus reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Leviticus collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/leviticus-week-1-with-wendell-devaney-cole

item.itunes:title: Ruth Week 2 with Suzy Silk
item.title: Ruth Week 2 with Suzy Silk
item.description:
For the second and final week in the book of Ruth, Raechal and Amanda are joined by pastor, teacher, and author Suzy Silk. Together they discuss the richness of the cultural implications found throughout Ruth and Naomi’s story and how God was at work in very unconventional ways. Join them and be reminded of the depth of our redemption that was foreshadowed in this story and fully realized in Jesus. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Ruth reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Title collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Ruth Week 1 with Kristi McLelland
item.title: Ruth Week 1 with Kristi McLelland
item.description:
Join us this week on the She Reads Truth podcast as Raechel and Amanda are joined by Bible teacher, professor, author, and biblical culturist, Kristi McLelland. From perpetual loss to abundant provision, the book of Ruth is full of surprises worth delighting in at every turn. Listen in as Raechel, Amanda, and Kristi encourage us to respond to the heart of God through the everyday details of our lives.

item.itunes:title: Amen and Amen Week 3 with Janice Gaines
item.title: Amen and Amen Week 3 with Janice Gaines
item.description:
Listen in to this week’s episode as Raechel and Amanda close out the final week of the Amen and Amen reading plan with singer, songwriter, and Bible teacher, Janice Gaines. Though the Psalms were written long ago, none of us can escape finding ourselves in them—a people prone to forgetfulness. Looking to Scripture, Raechel, Amanda, and Janice point out the way these psalms show us how to root our hope in God’s faithfulness—past, present, and future. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Amen and Amen reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Amen and Amen collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/amen-amen-week-3-with-janice-gaines

item.itunes:title: Amen & Amen Week 2 with Katherine Wolf
item.title: Amen & Amen Week 2 with Katherine Wolf
item.description:
For week 2 of Amen & Amen: A Journey Through the Psalms, Amanda and Raechel are joined by communicator, advocate, and author Katherine Wolf. Through discussing this week's psalms and as Katherine shares aspects of her own story, the three women hold in tension the range of emotions we all experience as people living in a broken world. Join us as we echo the joy and the lament of these psalms, testifying to the truth of who God is at every part of our journey. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Amen & Amen reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Title collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Amen & Amen Week 1 with Sho Baraka
item.title: Amen & Amen Week 1 with Sho Baraka
item.description:
Welcome to week 1 of Amen & Amen: A Journey Through the Psalms. Raechel and Amanda kick off this new series with artist and author Sho Baraka. Together they set up the framework for studying the book of Psalms, offering helpful context and details along the way. As the trio moves from psalm to psalm, they identify the range of deep emotions expressed by the psalmists as they pour out their hearts to God. We can come to God in the same way, with the assurance that He hears us and that He will respond to our prayers. Tune into the conversation!


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Amen & Amen: A Journey Through the Psalms reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Amen & Amen: A Journey Through the Psalms collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/amen-amen-week-1-with-sho-baraka

item.itunes:title: Exodus Week 6 with Raechel and Amanda
item.title: Exodus Week 6 with Raechel and Amanda
item.description:
In the sixth and final week of our Exodus reading plan, Raechel and Amanda discuss the beauty and provision we see in the building of the tabernacle. Every person, material, and process was intentional for God making a way for His people to come near to Him. Join us as we close out this rich book of the Bible and celebrate God’s gift of His presence that now indwells all believers. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 6 of the She Reads Truth Exodus reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Title collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Exodus Week 5 with Jake & Hannah Weidmann
item.title: Exodus Week 5 with Jake & Hannah Weidmann
item.description:
On this week’s episode, Raechel and Amanda continue their discussion of Exodus with artists Jake and Hannah Weidmann. As the group reads through passages from week 5, they discuss Israel’s activities in the wilderness as construction of the tabernacle continues. Tune in as they share insights on the nation’s relationship with God during this time and what we can learn from their actions. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 5 of the She Reads Truth Exodus reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Exodus Week 4 with Blair Linne
item.title: Exodus Week 4 with Blair Linne
item.description:
Join us for the fourth week of Exodus as Raechel and Amanda sit down with author, speaker, actress, and spoken word artist, Blair Linne. From the tent to the priestly garments, the details of the Lord’s glory and beauty are interwoven throughout each passage. Together, they marvel at the magnificence of God, who is not only the Creator, but also the ultimate architect, designer, and craftsman—seen throughout the detailed plans for His people in the book of Exodus as they prepare a place to dwell in His presence. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 4 of the She Reads Truth Exodus reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Exodus collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/exodus-week-4-with-blair-linne

item.itunes:title: Exodus Week 3 with Joel Muddamalle
item.title: Exodus Week 3 with Joel Muddamalle
item.description:
For Week 3 of our Exodus study, Raechel and Amanda are joined by Joel Muddamalle, Bible teacher and Director of Theology at Proverbs 31 Ministries. Together they discuss some of the larger motifs we see throughout the book of Exodus and how they point us to remember who God is and how He has always been providing faithfully for His people. Join us for a rich discussion about the events in their particular historical contexts and how we can more fully step into the reality of who we are in Christ—a holy nation and a royal priesthood. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Exodus reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Title collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/exodus-week-3-with-joel-muddamalle

item.itunes:title: Exodus Week 2 with Margaret Feinberg
item.title: Exodus Week 2 with Margaret Feinberg
item.description:
On this week’s episode, Raechel and Amanda discuss the second week of readings in Exodus with author, speaker, and fellow podcaster Margaret Feinberg. The three discuss God’s provision for Israel, from their escape from Egypt to their early days in the wilderness. Join them for an insightful discussion of the first Passover, the Exodus, and the lasting value of this story of God’s deliverance of His people.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Exodus reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.title: This Is the Church Week 5 with Anne Lincoln Holibaugh
item.description:
In the fifth and final week of our This Is the Church study, Raechal and Amanda are joined by Anne Lincoln Holibaugh, Associate Minister of Family Ministries at The Village Church Denton. The three reflect on the journey of this study and how who we are as God’s people—those who have been reconciled to Him—informs how we live together in unity as His Church. Join us for the concluding conversation around this reading plan as we remember that we are flawed people on this journey of faith, but called to anchor our lives and ministries in the person, work, and hope of Jesus.

item.title: This Is the Church Week 4 with Dr. Christina Edmondson
item.description:
On this week’s podcast episode, Raechel and Amanda dive deeper into the This Is the Church reading plan with educator, advocate, and speaker Dr. Christina Edmondson. How do we love one another well, even when we deeply disagree with each other? What does unity in the Church look like when we have doctrinal differences? Tune into a deep and rich conversation on how being rooted in Christ’s sacrificial love is foundational to living together in community.

item.itunes:title: This Is the Church Week 2 with Sam and Toni Collier
item.title: This Is the Church Week 2 with Sam and Toni Collier
item.description:
On this week’s episode, Amanda joins Sam and Toni Collier to continue our study of the Church. Sam is a local church pastor and author, and his wife Toni is a ministry leader and author. Together they begin to explore some of the metaphors found in Scripture that describe Christ’s relationship with His Church and believers’ relationships with one another. Join us in listening as we are reminded of the beauty of the diverse body of Christ and what is possible when each unique believer is empowered by the Spirit and in pursuit of the same mission.

item.title: This Is the Gospel Week 2 with Dr. Don Payne

For Week 2 of This Is the Gospel, Raechel and Amanda are joined by Dr. Don Payne, professor and dean at Denver Seminary. Picking up after last week’s reflection about creation and humanity’s fall into sin, the three discuss the hope of our redemption and restoration that is only possible through the person and work of Jesus. Join in as we reflect on the comprehensive salvation we have in the life, death, resurrection, and ascension of Christ.

item.itunes:title: Bonus Episode: SRT’s 10th Birthday Partnership with illumiNations
item.title: Bonus Episode: SRT’s 10th Birthday Partnership with illumiNations
item.description:
Listen in as Amanda and Raechel talk with Emily Vogeltanz from illumiNations in this week’s bonus podcast episode!


There are more than 1 billion people around the world with little or no access to Scripture. But now, thanks to illumiNations, we have the opportunity to help end Bible poverty by 2033. To celebrate 10 years of reading God's Word together as the She Reads Truth community, we're joining the movement to get Scripture translated into every language, for every person, on earth!

Will you join us? Visit 12vc.com/SheReadsTruth to be part of the movement.

See this episode's show notes at shereadstruth.com/podcast/bonus-episode-srts-10th-birthday-partnership-with-illuminations.

Join us for week 2 of our 1 & 2 Timothy reading plan as Raechel and Amanda discuss the Scripture with guest Kelsey Hency, author and editor. As they finish up the final chapters of 1 Timothy, the three discuss the beauty and responsibility of life in the family of God as we learn from Paul’s encouragement and challenges to Timothy. Listen in with us as we ask good questions of God’s Word together and discuss both its original context and how we can apply it to our lives now.

This week, Amanda and Raechel discuss the sandals of the gospel of peace, the shield of faith, the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit with author and Bible teacher, Kelly Needham. item.title: Lent Week 7 with Jennie Allen
item.description:
Join us for week 7 of our Lent reading plan as we have finally arrived at Holy Week! Raechel and Amanda are joined by author and speaker, Jennie Allen to walk through the Gospel readings from Palm Sunday through Holy Saturday (Come back for a special bonus episode on Easter Sunday!). Together, the three celebrate the hope that Holy Week brings as Jesus lifts our eyes and shifts our perspective toward eternity, becoming the sufficient sacrifice for our sins. As we walk the final journey with Jesus toward the cross, we remember and give thanks that Resurrection Sunday is coming.

item.itunes:title: Lent Week 6 with Dr. Danny Hays
item.title: Lent Week 6 with Dr. Danny Hays
item.description:
Join us for the sixth week in the book of Ezekiel as Raechel and Amanda talk with Old Testament professor, Dr. Danny Hays. Together, they dig into the nitty gritty details of hope found in the concluding chapters of Ezekiel. Whether talking about the dimensions of the temple or land allotments, Dr. Hays constantly points us back to the emphasis all of Ezekiel has been building on—the presence of God. 

As we prepare for Holy Week, listen in as they constantly point out the themes in Ezekiel we see throughout Scripture from Genesis to Revelation. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 6 of the She Reads Truth Lent 2022: Come to Life reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Lent 2022: Come to Life collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/lent-week-6-with-dr-danny-hays

item.itunes:title: Lent Week 5 with Raechel and Amanda
item.title: Lent Week 5 with Raechel and Amanda
item.description:
As Raechel and Amanda discuss week 5 of the Lent reading plan, they grow more excited with each day’s reading. The passages found in Ezekiel communicate to God’s people the harsh consequences of their sins. The book of Ezekiel is also a message of God’s enduring love. The thread of hope that runs through the book of Ezekiel is the promise of restoration because of God’s mercy and faithfulness. Join them as they discuss what that hope meant for God’s people then and what it means for His people now.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 5 of the She Reads Truth She Reads Truth Lent 2022: Come to Life reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the She Reads Truth Lent 2022: Come to Life collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Lent Week 4 with Kelly Minter
item.title: Lent Week 4 with Kelly Minter
item.description:
During the fourth week of our Lenten study of Ezekiel, Raechel sits down with Kelly Minter, a singer, writer, speaker, and student of God’s Word. Together, they reflect on the despair we find throughout Ezekiel as we come face-to-face with the Lord’s response to sin. Yet, it’s in the book of Ezekiel that we have a chance to sit in and think on the darkness of our own sin, knowing that this is the very darkness Jesus has rescued us from. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 4 of the She Reads Truth Lent 2022: Come to Life reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Lent 2022 collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Lent Week 3 with Dr. Bryan Loritts
item.title: Lent Week 3 with Dr. Bryan Loritts
item.description:
We are excited to have Dr. Bryan Loritts, author, pastor, and speaker, joining Raechel and Amanda for week 3 of Lent 2022: Come to Life. The prophets and the season of Lent provide a unique and rich opportunity for believers to examine our own hearts and the idols of our own making, and be reminded of our need for a Savior. Join them as they discuss God’s call, not to religion, but to repent and turn back to Him, trusting that He is the only one who can give us a new heart.

item.itunes:title: Lent Week 2 with Lydia Brownback
item.title: Lent Week 2 with Lydia Brownback
item.description:
For week 2 of Lent 2022: Come to Life, Raechel and Amanda explore more of Ezekiel’s sign acts, prophecies, and visions with author and Bible teacher Lydia Brownback. The book of Ezekiel points out to us our great need for a Savior. The imagery and dialogue can be hard to bear, but the three continually point out the threads of hope throughout the readings. Join them as they discuss how the scriptures found in Ezekiel are not only relevant for us but they are ultimately good news.

item.itunes:title: Lent Week 1 with Melissa Kruger
item.title: Lent Week 1 with Melissa Kruger
item.description:
Join us as we kick off our 7-week Lenten study of Ezekiel with special guest Melissa Kruger. Melissa is the director of women’s initiatives for the Gospel Coalition and is the author of several books. What is Lent? Who can celebrate it? And why are we reading Ezekiel together in this season? Listen in to this week’s episode as Raechel, Amanda, and Melissa discuss these questions together and begin to immerse themselves in the story of Ezekiel, reminding one another that whether we are reading Ezekiel, or any other book in Scripture, God’s unchanging character is the same on every page.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Lent 2022: Come to Life reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Lent 2022 collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/lent-week-1-with-melissa-kruger

item.itunes:title: Do Not Fear Week 3 with Scarlet Hiltibidal
item.title: Do Not Fear Week 3 with Scarlet Hiltibidal
item.description:
For the third and final week of Do Not Fear, Raechel and Amanda welcome author and speaker Scarlet Hiltibidal back to the podcast. They revisit narratives from the Bible that required God’s people to look to Him in the face of fear. from Moses’s burning-bush encounter with God to the woman with the issue of blood being healed by Jesus. Join them as they discuss what it means to trust and remember God’s goodness and faithfulness especially in the hard seasons of life.

item.itunes:title: Do Not Fear Week 1 with Sissy Goff
item.title: Do Not Fear Week 1 with Sissy Goff
item.description:
For the first week of our Do Not Fear reading plan, Raechel and Amanda are joined by best-selling author and counselor, Sissy Goff. Building a foundation for the next three weeks of discussion, they explore the hope and goal of this plan—not that we would be cured of fear in three weeks, but that we learn to look to the One who is faithful in our fear. Throughout the episode, the three explore not only their own experiences with fear, but look to stories of Scripture where men and women learned about God’s character and saw His action on display amid their fear-filled circumstances. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Do Not Fear reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Do Not Fear collection at https://www.shopshereadstruth.com/collections/do-not-fear. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/do-not-fear-week-1-with-sissy-goff.

item.itunes:title: John Week 4 with Vaneetha Rendall Risner
item.title: John Week 4 with Vaneetha Rendall Risner
item.description:
Join us for the fourth week of the Gospel of John as Amanda welcomes author Vaneetha Risner to the podcast. Together, they read and discuss several passages of Scripture that have been transformative in Vaneetha’s own testimony. What does it look like to confess Jesus as Savior in our words and actions? Do people see the gospel in our lives through our love? What are Vaneetha’s three go-to prepositions in times of suffering? Throughout the episode, they unpack these questions and more as they are reminded through Scripture of our greatest hope and only true comfort in the sorrow and suffering of this world.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 4 of the She Reads Truth John reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.title: John Week 2 with Jeannie Cunnion
item.description:
This week, Amanda and author, Bible teacher, and speaker Jeannie Cunnion discuss week 2 of the John reading plan. Each chapter prompts them to  reflect on how each encounter and words from the Gospel points to Jesus as the Son of God. And each metaphor that expresses Him—from the Bread of Life to the Light of the World—communicates the good news of the gospel. Join them as they reflect on who Jesus is and what that revelation means for us..

item.title: John Week 1 with Jon Tyson
item.description:
Kick off your new year in the Gospel of John with Raechel, Amanda, and author, pastor, and church planter, Jon Tyson. Whether engaging in conversation about prioritizing consistency in the small things or sitting in wonder of the way God has revealed Himself to us, Raechel, Amanda, and Jon never fail to point us to the fullness, joy, and hope found only in Jesus Christ. Throughout the episode, join these three in responding to the hopeful invitation of John’s Gospel to “come and see” who Jesus is as we begin to dig into this Gospel.

item.title: Advent Week 2 with Ruth Chou Simons
item.description:
Welcome to the second week of Advent 2021: The Everlasting Light! This week, join Raechel and Amanda as they trace the promises of light throughout several Old Testament narratives, alongside their friend, author, artist, entrepreneur, speaker, and mom to half a dozen boys, Ruth Chou Simons. Encouragement can be found at every twist and turn of this week’s conversation as the three remind one another that despite our natural tendencies, we can leave the chaos of the season and our never ending Christmas checklists behind as we intentionally seek to make much of Jesus through a few small, yet meaningful moments with those we love.

item.content:encoded:
Welcome to the second week of Advent 2021: The Everlasting Light! This week, join Raechel and Amanda as they trace the promises of light throughout several Old Testament narratives, alongside their friend, author, artist, entrepreneur, speaker, and mom to half a dozen boys, Ruth Chou Simons. Encouragement can be found at every twist and turn of this week’s conversation as the three remind one another that despite our natural tendencies, we can leave the chaos of the season and our never ending Christmas checklists behind as we intentionally seek to make much of Jesus through a few small, yet meaningful moments with those we love. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Advent 2021: The Everlasting Light reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.title: Advent Week 1 with Annie F. Downs
item.description:
It’s the first week of Advent! Raechel and Amanda kick off the reading plan with good friend, speaker, and New York Times bestselling author, Annie F. Downs. The three discuss the theme of light in Scripture, starting with Jesus’s declaration as the Light of the World and trace the metaphors for light through the narrative of the Bible. Join along as they dive deeper into how Christ, the everlasting light, shines in the midst of the darkness that surrounds us.

item.itunes:title: One Another Week 2 with Bailey T. Hurley
item.title: One Another Week 2 with Bailey T. Hurley
item.description:
In our last week of One Another, Amanda discusses the joys and challenges of Christian community with Bailey T. Hurley, a writer and speaker who encourages women to pursue a relationship with God so they can pursue their people in meaningful friendship. They talk about encouragement, hospitality, forgiveness, and ways we can generously offer the gift of our presence. If Jesus is our foundation, there are many different ways to be in community with one another, and we can know Him more fully because of it.

item.itunes:title: One Another Week 1 with Alison Cook
item.title: One Another Week 1 with Alison Cook
item.description:
For the first week in our One Another study, Amanda talks with Alison Cook, a psychologist speaker and author who helps women live out their God-given potential. Together, they explore relationships in the body of Christ and the importance of healthy boundaries. Ultimately, we are called to live in community. And, as the Church, it’s our responsibility and privilege to do this in a way that models Jesus. Join us as we reflect on Scripture’s commands to love and care for one another as we seek to live in unity with our fellow brothers and sisters.

item.itunes:title: Acts Week 6 with Mika Edmondson
item.title: Acts Week 6 with Mika Edmondson
item.description:
For the final week of our journey through the book of Acts, Amanda is joined by Mika Edmondson, an author and the pastor of CPC Koinonia in Nashville. There’s a shipwreck, a storm, soldiers, and open-hearted island people. During Paul’s “tour of trials” as Amanda calls it, we watch the Lord carry him through and provide wonders and signs that signal the inbreaking of the kingdom. Friends, no matter what suffering we endure, God is eager to meet us in it and show His faithfulness.   


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 6 of the She Reads Truth Acts reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.description:
It’s the halfway point of our Acts study! Raechel and Amanda welcome Dr. Heather Thompson Day to the podcast to talk through Acts 14–17. As they trace Paul’s footsteps through the daily readings, they observe the Church’s deep commitment to the gospel—in spite of opposition. Join them as they reflect on what it means for God’s community of believers to follow Him in a world that rejects the ways of Jesus.

item.title: Acts Week 3 with John Mark Comer
item.description:
For the third week of our Acts study, Amanda talks with John Mark Comer, a bestselling author, executive director of Practicing the Way, and apprentice of Jesus from Portland, Oregon. Together, they look at what the early Church was like, how it grew, and the Holy Spirit’s work through God’s people. We hope you walk away with a renewed gratitude for Christ’s message of salvation—the good news that unites everyone, both Jews and Gentiles alike.

It’s already the final week in Hosea, and Raechel and Amanda sit down with writer, poet, bible teacher, and hip-hop artist, Jackie Hill Perry. While reading the second half of this minor prophet, we witness God’s relentless faithfulness to a rebellious nation and learn how His holiness is worthy of our celebration. Together, may we learn from the story of Israel and always remember to turn back to the Lord our God.

For the first week of our Hosea study, Raechel and Amanda talk about God’s redeeming love with best-selling author, Francine Rivers. item.title: Deuteronomy Week 3 with Dr. George Grant
item.description:
In this week’s episode, Raechel and Amanda sit down with pastor, author, and long-time friend, Dr. George Grant, for the third week in our study of Deuteronomy. Together with our hosts, Dr. Grant explores the topic of grace, and how Christ did not come to abolish the law, but to fulfill it perfectly so that we can live a life of obedience. Listen along as we read about God’s desire for His children to flourish by embracing what is right and good and true.

For the second week of our Deuteronomy study, Raechel and Amanda continue to read with author, speaker, and Bible teacher, Tasha Calvert. They discuss ancient festivals, the practice of giving, worship that reflects God’s heart for justice, and encouraging each other in the Word—and how these are all acts of obedience in response to what God has already done. Listen along as we remember the God who sets Himself apart as holy, yet chooses to dwell with His people.

item.title: This Is the New Testament Week 3 with Jennifer Lucy Tyler
item.description:
It’s the third week of This Is the New Testament, and Raechel and Amanda are joined by Jennifer Lucy Tyler, a speaker, ministry leader, and fellow lover of God’s Word. Together, they look at five more of Paul’s epistles and explore questions like, “What does it look like for God to direct our hearts?” and “How do we endure suffering faithfully in Christ?” Listen along as their conversation reminds us that, no matter our circumstances, the Lord is our hope, and it is Christ who strengthens and sustains us. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth This Is the New Testament reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the This Is the New Testament collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: This Is the New Testament Week 2 with Kim Cash Tate
item.title: This Is the New Testament Week 2 with Kim Cash Tate
item.description:
Raechel and Amanda are joined for the second week of This Is the New Testament by author, Bible teacher, and singer/songwriter Kim Cash Tate. As the three women discuss Paul’s letters, from Romans to Ephesians, they identify the gospel at the heart of all of the apostle’s messages. Tune in for a lively discussion of what it means for a community of believers to live in response to the gospel in every season of life.

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth This Is the New Testament reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: This Is the New Testament Week 1 with Tara-Leigh Cobble
item.title: This Is the New Testament Week 1 with Tara-Leigh Cobble
item.description:
Join Amanda and Raechel for the first week of This Is the New Testament, along with The Bible Recap founder and “Tour Guide of the Bible,” Tara-Leigh Cobble. Why do we have four different Gospels? What does each Gospel reveal about Jesus? How do we see God’s unified character across the Old and New Testaments? And how is the wrath of God praiseworthy? Listen in to this conversation discussing the Gospel story that began in the Old Testament and continues into the New.

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth This Is the New Testament reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the This Is the New Testament Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/this-is-the-new-testament-week-1-with-tara-leigh-cobble

item.itunes:title: This Is the Old Testament Week 7 with Nancy Guthrie
item.title: This Is the Old Testament Week 7 with Nancy Guthrie
item.description:
For the last week of This Is the Old Testament, Raechel and Amanda are joined by author, teacher, and speaker Nancy Guthrie. As the three look at the last five books of the Old Testament, Nancy helps to set a framework for studying and understanding these prophetic books. From Habakkuk to Malachi, they continue to see God’s promise of salvation unfolding as the prophecies of the Old Testament look forward to fulfillment by Christ in the New Testament.

item.itunes:title: This Is the Old Testament Week 6 with Trillia Newbell
item.title: This Is the Old Testament Week 6 with Trillia Newbell
item.description:
For the sixth week of This Is the Old Testament, Raechel and Amanda welcome author and editor Trillia Newbell back to the podcast to discuss the Prophetic Books of Amos through Nahum. Whether you have apprehension or affection for the Minor Prophets, these three friends remind us that the prophetic genre testifies to God’s character, displaying His pursuit of His people by speaking through each prophet. From one prophetic book to the next, they consistently point out the comforting truth that God’s multifaceted character is not limited by our finite understanding. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 6 of the She Reads Truth This Is the Old Testament reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the This Is the Old Testament Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/this-is-the-old-testament-week-6-with-trillia-newbell/

item.itunes:title: This Is the Old Testament Week 5 with Kelly Minter
item.title: This Is the Old Testament Week 5 with Kelly Minter
item.description:
Raechel and Amanda welcome five-time podcast guest, author, and teacher Kelly Minter back to the podcast for Week 5 of This Is the Old Testament. As they walk through the prophetic books of Jeremiah through Joel, they continue to identify a recurring theme—God’s relentless love for His people. Whether discussing hard truths in Ezekiel or promises of restoration in Joel, they continue to remind each other of God’s faithfulness expressed in His Word.

item.itunes:title: This Is the Old Testament Week 4 with Ginny Owens
item.title: This Is the Old Testament Week 4 with Ginny Owens
item.description:
Join Raechel and Amanda for a conversation about the Old Testament with singer, songwriter, author, and teacher Ginny Owens. While discussing books of Wisdom Literature and the Prophetic book of Isaiah, the three remind one another of God’s good gifts to us, from the song book of Psalms and the hope of Isaiah, to Central Park as a blurry glimpse of heaven. Whatever season you find yourself in, join Raechel, Amanda, and Ginny in rejoicing in God’s presence through His Word, trusting that the same God seen in the pages of Scripture is the same God in and with His people today.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 4 of the She Reads Truth This Is the Old Testament reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 


Shop the This Is the Old Testament Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 


Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/this-is-the-old-testament-week-4-with-ginny-owens/

item.title: This Is the Old Testament Week 3 with Liz Curtis Higgs
item.description:
Raechel and Amanda are joined by author and speaker Liz Curtis Higgs for Week 3 of This Is the Old Testament. The three enjoy a delightful time in the Word as they continue to thread the redemption story through the Old Testament from the books of 1 & 2 Kings to the book of Job. Tune in as they highlight God’s faithfulness in every account, constantly pointing to His use of imperfect people to carry out His perfect plan.

item.itunes:title: This Is the Old Testament Week 2 with David Filson
item.title: This Is the Old Testament Week 2 with David Filson
item.description:
Join Raechel and Amanda along with pastor and professor David Filson for the second week of This Is the Old Testament. Together, these three take a look at the historical books of Joshua, Judges, Ruth, and 1 & 2 Samuel—reminiscing on familiar stories and rejoicing in the discovery of connections between these books and the whole of Scripture. As they survey these five books, they continually point to God’s faithfulness to Israel and His preserving work throughout the narrative of the Old Testament. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth This Is the Old Testament reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 


Shop the This Is the Old Testament Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: This Is the Old Testament Week 1 with Tara-Leigh Cobble
item.title: This Is the Old Testament Week 1 with Tara-Leigh Cobble
item.description:
Join Amanda Bible Williams and She Reads Truth’s editorial director Jessica Lamb as they talk with The Bible Recap and D-Group founder, Tara-Leigh Cobble in the first episode on our thematic study of the Old Testament. As the three survey key verses from the first five books of the Bible, they establish a framework for faithfully studying Scripture and looking for God’s relational character on every page. Join us in rejoicing in the gift of God’s Word, discussing the freeing and transformative shift of looking for God in Scripture before looking for ourselves.

item.title: Colossians and Philemon Week 2 with Kristie Anyabwile
item.description:
On this week’s episode, Amanda wraps up our Colossians and Philemon series with Bible teacher, author, and speaker, Kristie Anyabwile. Together, they discuss Paul’s specific instructions to Philemon and the apostle’s other teachings directed towards members that made up a first-century household. Join in as Amanda and Kristie remind us that our position in Christ gives us the freedom to show God’s abundant love to others.

item.itunes:title: Colossians and Philemon Week 1 with Angie Smith
item.title: Colossians and Philemon Week 1 with Angie Smith
item.description:
For the first week of our Colossians and Philemon series, Amanda and Raechel are joined by speaker and best-selling author, Angie Smith. Join us as the three friends connect the dots between these two letters, focusing on the supremacy of Christ and how His gospel shapes the ways in which we relate to one another. This includes giving thanks for each other, asking for forgiveness, and seeking reconciliation. Whether our relationship exists through social media or in-person community, the love of Christ should be the driving force behind all we say and do.

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth The Kingdom of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop The Kingdom of God collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: The Kingdom of God Week 3 with Lysa TerKeurst
item.title: The Kingdom of God Week 3 with Lysa TerKeurst
item.description:
For the third and final week of our Kingdom of God series, we hear from Amanda and Raechel’s guest Lysa TerKeurst—an author, speaker, and Bible teacher. Together, they untangle topics like pursuing holiness and how to think biblically about the inclusive and exclusive nature of the gospel. Lysa shares her personal journey with forgiveness and how the act of forgiving those who’ve hurt us is “one of the most beautiful evidences of being a citizen of the kingdom of heaven.” During this hour, we learn about the true meaning of the gospel: it is an invitation into a new way of being and a new God-given identity.   

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth The Kingdom of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop The Kingdom of God collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/the-kingdom-of-god-week-3-with-lysa-terkeurst

item.itunes:title: The Kingdom of God Week 2 with Ellie Holcomb
item.title: The Kingdom of God Week 2 with Ellie Holcomb
item.description:
Join Raechel and Amanda for the second week of The Kingdom of God reading plan with singer, songwriter, and author, Ellie Holcomb. As they explore the ever surprising realities of the upside down nature of the kingdom of God, they talk about everything from edible flower arrangements to seeing the beauty of the present and coming kingdom through childlike eyes. Along the way, they challenge us to consider the kingdom through the perspective of others, leaving us with a question to faithfully approach conversation with those who are different from us—Will you help me see Jesus through your eyes?

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth The Kingdom of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: The Kingdom of God Week 1 with Matt Chandler
item.title: The Kingdom of God Week 1 with Matt Chandler
item.description:
Raechel and Amanda kick off The Kingdom of God series with Matt Chandler, lead pastor of The Village Church in Texas and president of the church planting network, Acts 29. As they discuss King Jesus and His reign, Matt helps us understand the already-and-not-yet nature of the kingdom and why eschatology isn’t such a scary word. Join the conversation as we deepen our understanding of what life on earth looks like for citizens of this not-of-this world kingdom.

item.itunes:title: 1 & 2 Thessalonians Week 3 with Jess Connolly
item.title: 1 & 2 Thessalonians Week 3 with Jess Connolly
item.description:
Join Raechel and Amanda as they study Scripture with Jess Connolly, an author, original member of the She Reads Truth community, founder of the Go + Tell Gals, and leader of Bright City Church alongside her husband. How can we live in the abundance of the gospel here and now? What does it look like to reflect on God’s judgement in our own lives? And why doesn’t Instagram make a great pastor? Listen in to this week’s conversation as we answer these questions and more, closing out our time together in 1 & 2 Thessalonians.

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth 1 & 2 Thessalonians reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: 1 & 2 Thessalonians Week 2 with Jonathan Pitts
item.title: 1 & 2 Thessalonians Week 2 with Jonathan Pitts
item.description:
It’s our second week in 1 Thessalonians! Raechel and Amanda read the rest of the apostle Paul’s letter with Jonathan Pitts, a pastor, author, and father of four. Having walked through his own season of grief recently, Jonathan speaks to the believer’s hope that death is not final and every loss will find its resurrection in Jesus. From Paul’s instructions (or “four-word sermons”) on practical holiness, to his beautiful benediction, the three friends discuss how we are called to live lives of daily faithfulness that ring out for Christ until the day we are united with Him. They also celebrate the reality that He who calls us is faithful—He will do what He has promised!

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth 1 & 2 Thessalonians reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the 1 & 2 Thessalonians collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.title: 1 & 2 Thessalonians Week 1 with Whitney Capps
item.description:
Join us as we dive into 1 Thessalonians as Raechel and Amanda study the book’s early chapters with speaker, author, and teacher Whitney Capps. Together they discuss Paul’s encouraging and challenging words to a young community of believers who faced opposition as they lived in anticipation of the Lord’s return. As we also wait for Jesus’s second coming, the apostle’s message of perseverance motivates us to continue living out the gospel with one another, faithfully serving the Lord with love and enduring hope.

item.itunes:title: Mark Week 3 with Scott Sauls
item.title: Mark Week 3 with Scott Sauls
item.description:
It’s Holy Week, when we observe Jesus’s journey to the cross and His triumphant resurrection on Easter Sunday. In our final week studying the Gospel of Mark, Raechel and Amanda continue the conversation alongside author, Nashville pastor, and friend, Scott Sauls. Together, they walk through Holy Week (which has two extra days of readings!) and talk about Passover hymns, peach Easter dresses, wrestling with doubt, and the beautiful climax of Mark. Join us in celebration as we remember how our Savior Jesus reconciled us to everlasting life with Him. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Mark reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Mark Week 2 with Lisa Harper
item.title: Mark Week 2 with Lisa Harper
item.description:
Author, speaker, and mom Lisa Harper returns to the podcast to discuss week 2 of our Mark reading plan with Raechel and Amanda. As they follow Jesus’s journey from Galilee to Jerusalem, they share insights about His interactions with the people He encountered; how He was moved by their pain and eager to show them compassion. Join us for a conversation that points us to the One who loves us most. His arms are open, and He refuses to turn us away—no matter who we are or what we’ve done.

item.itunes:title: Mark Week 1 with Lauren Chandler
item.title: Mark Week 1 with Lauren Chandler
item.description:
Join us for a running start into the book of Mark as Raechel and Amanda study the first six chapters with Lauren Chandler, an author, worship leader, pastor’s wife, and mom of three. As they read this fast-paced Gospel, they share in the amazement and wonder we can experience as we see the authority of Jesus on display. From beginning to end, this episode reminds us that when we bring our deepest desires to Jesus, He makes us intimately aware of what our greatest need truly is—a need only satisfied in His life, death, and resurrection.

item.itunes:title: Joshua Week 4 with Jada Edwards
item.title: Joshua Week 4 with Jada Edwards
item.description:
It's week four of Lent and the final week of our Joshua series! Raechel and Amanda catch up with author, Bible teacher, and returning guest Jada Edwards. Together, they read the beautiful conclusion to Joshua’s story, where we watch God fulfill His promises to the Israelites. As the three friends talk about everything from leadership and covenants to sewer grates in the Holy Land, they offer us this comforting truth: God is always faithful to His people, and because of this, we can joyfully remember and proclaim His work in our lives.

item.title: Joshua Week 3 with Kevin and Rea Queen
item.description:
It's week 3 of our Joshua series, and Raechel and Amanda sit down with Pastor Kevin Queen and his wife Rea, a long-time member of the She Reads Truth community. Together they explore the week's reading and discuss the way it challenges us to walk closely with the Lord and look for His kindness in the details of our everyday lives. In a week full of hard to pronounce names and passages where we long for clarity, we take comfort in our shared calling: to trust Jesus and keep our eyes on Him.

item.itunes:title: Joshua Week 2 with Jim Thomas
item.title: Joshua Week 2 with Jim Thomas
item.description:
On this week’s episode, Pastor Jim Thomas joins Raechel and Amanda for Week 2 in the book of Joshua, covering stories from the sobering tale of Achan’s disobedience to the miraculous pausing of the sun. Against the backdrop of this narrative, they discuss God’s sovereignty, holiness, faithfulness and what our response to His instructions should look like. Pastor Jim also gives us a helpful framework for understanding hard-to-read verses—the ones you’d think twice about embroidering on a pillow!

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Joshua reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

Join Raechel and Amanda as they kick off the Lenten season in the book of Joshua with activist, author, and speaker, Christine Caine. Why is Joshua one of Christine’s favorite books of the Bible? item.itunes:title: Esther Week 1 with Vivian Mabuni
item.title: Esther Week 1 with Vivian Mabuni
item.description:
It’s the first week in our Esther series! Raechel and Amanda sit down with speaker, author, and Bible teacher, Vivian Mabuni. Calling in from the West coast, Vivian wakes up extra early to dive into one of her favorite books of the Bible: Esther, a book about the young Jewish queen who fights for her people. The three women discuss royal banquets and beauty pageants, fasting and lamenting, and what it looks like to serve without seeing a reward or outcome. This week’s reading ends with a cliffhanger, challenging us to follow God while remembering what’s true—even when we can’t see the end of the story.  

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Esther reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Esther collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/esther-week-1-with-vivian-mabuni/

item.itunes:title: Faith in Practice Week 4 with Kelly Minter
item.title: Faith in Practice Week 4 with Kelly Minter
item.description:
For the final episode of our Faith in Practice series, join us for a conversation among friends with author, speaker, and songwriter Kelly Minter. This week, Raechel, Amanda, and Kelly engage in an honest and vulnerable conversation about their difficult, yet freeing personal experiences with the disciplines of solitude, silence, simplicity, chastity, and remembrance. Connecting the practice of these disciplines to everything from the rhythms of Peloton workouts to Portuguese lessons, they help us tackle the often unasked yet wrestled with question, Can freedom and discipline co-exist? 

 Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 4 of the She Reads Truth Faith in Practice reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Faith in Practice Week 3 with Rebekah Lyons
item.title: Faith in Practice Week 3 with Rebekah Lyons
item.description:
For the third week of our Faith in Practice series, bestselling author and speaker Rebekah Lyons returns to the podcast, just over a year to the date! She talks with Raechel and Amanda about the surprising spiritual discipline of celebration, which can include some fierce dancing (we see you King David). The three also discuss connections between the disciplines of worship, submission, and confession and how remembrance of God’s goodness shows up in each one. As they dive deep into their discussion, the common takeaway is this—the goal of these spiritual disciplines is not about checking boxes, but growing in our relationship with God.

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Faith in Practice reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com

item.itunes:title: Faith in Practice Week 2 with Annie F. Downs
item.title: Faith in Practice Week 2 with Annie F. Downs
item.description:
On the second episode of our Faith in Practice series, Raechel and Amanda explore six spiritual practices with good friend, author, and fellow podcaster Annie F. Downs. The three talk about serving, using Instagram carousels to memorize Scripture, and how spiritual disciplines train the heart toward Jesus. Annie tells us why she recites the Apostles’ Creed while making tea in the morning, and we learn that spiritual practices and the Body of Christ cannot exist independently from one another. Together, we can let ourselves be beginners, invite each other into the process, and pursue spiritual practices “imperfectly and with conviction.” 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Faith in Practice reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Faith in Practice collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/faith-in-practice-week-2-with-annie-f-downs/

item.itunes:title: Faith in Practice Week 1 with John Mark Comer
item.title: Faith in Practice Week 1 with John Mark Comer
item.description:
For the first episode of the new year and the start of our Faith in Practice series, Raechel and Amanda talk with pastor, author, and hurry-eliminator John Mark Comer. On the heels of an unexpected 2020, and with the hope of a brand new year ahead, they explore what it really means to live like Jesus. How do we create everyday rhythms that bring fulfillment instead of emptiness and exhaustion? Touching on topics from marathon training and New Years de-resolutions to prayer and peppermint mochas, their conversation keeps coming back to one key question: what would Jesus do if He were me?

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Faith in Practice reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.title: Q&A with Raechel & Amanda
item.description:
You asked and they’re answering! The tables are turned on this week’s bonus podcast episode—Krista Williams guest hosts and asks Raechel and Amanda questions from the She Reads Truth community. The three discuss all things SRT, from how it all started to their continued passion for reading the Word every day. Along the way, you’ll discover the two co-founders’ favorite books of the Bible (Amanda can hardly pick just one!) and where they’re seeing beauty, goodness, and truth these days. The conversation lands with excitement about upcoming reading plans and encountering God through His Word in the new year.

This episode corresponds to the free, one-week Open Your Bibles reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

Along the way, you’ll discover the two co-founders’ favorite books of the Bible (Amanda can hardly pick just one!) and where they’re seeing beauty, goodness, and truth these days. The conversation lands with excitement about upcoming reading plans and encountering God through His Word in the new year.

This episode corresponds to the free, one-week Open Your Bibles reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Open Your Bibles Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Advent 2020 Week 4 with Drew and Ellie Holcomb
item.title: Advent 2020 Week 4 with Drew and Ellie Holcomb
item.description:
For the final week of our Advent 2020 series, Raechel and Amanda talk with the very neighborly singer-songwriters, Drew and Ellie Holcomb. As the couple shares about the time they took cover from a tornado in the Schermerhorn Symphony Center, they also marvel at the audacity of God wrapping Himself in flesh to become one of us. Together, our musical guests play two carols and remind us that no matter where we find ourselves—whether the rim of the Grand Canyon or the stage of an empty auditorium—we can keep singing hope into the darkness. During a time when it feels like we’ve been “adventing” all year, we find comfort in the never-changing heart of the Christmas story: God is with us, always. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 4 of the She Reads Truth Advent 2020 reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Advent 2020 collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/advent-2020-week-4-with-drew-and-ellie-holcomb/

item.itunes:title: Advent 2020 Week 3 with Jillian Edwards
item.title: Advent 2020 Week 3 with Jillian Edwards
item.description:
It’s the third week of our Advent 2020 series, and Raechel and Amanda welcome singer-songwriter, long-time She, and new friend Jillian Edwards to the podcast. Bonding over their love of pajama-themed Christmas gifts and holiday hymns, the three discuss the longing of that first Advent—about Jesus's perfect love, His power to heal, and His role as the Lamb of God who takes away the sins of the world. Jillian’s ethereal voice mesmerizes the room as she plays her own song, Mary’s Lullaby, and the classic Away in a Manger. Join us as we lean into the longing of the first Advent and the promise of the next. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Advent 2020 reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Advent 2020 collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Advent 2020 Week 2 with Natalie Grant and Bernie Herms
item.title: Advent 2020 Week 2 with Natalie Grant and Bernie Herms
item.description:
Join us for the second week of our Advent 2020 series as Raechel and Amanda celebrate the season with singer and songwriter, Natalie Grant, and singer, musician, and producer, Bernie Herms. In between singing Angels We Have Heard on High and Silent Night, the four friends talk about everything from the ideal time to decorate for Christmas and German Christmas traditions, to their shared desperation for celebration at the end of 2020. As they read Scripture together and rejoice in its power and authority, they consistently encourage one another to live out the radical love of Jesus.

item.itunes:title: Advent 2020 Week 1 with Dave Barnes
item.title: Advent 2020 Week 1 with Dave Barnes
item.description:
For the first week of our Advent 2020 series, Amanda and Raechel spend time with songwriter, podcast host, and comedian, Dave Barnes. During the episode, they explain how Advent is Latin for “arrival,” and talk about the importance of waiting as we prepare for Christmas Day. Dave compares this year to playing an accordion and shares two of his Christmas songs (but not his funky new version of Go, Tell It on the Mountain—we have to wait for that too!). Together, the three laugh about everything from mowing lawns to Instagram characters, and they offer some comforting answers to the profoundly multilayered and hope-filled question of why Jesus came.

Show notes: shereadstruth.com/podcast/advent-2020-week-1-with-dave-barnes/

item.itunes:title: The Fruit of the Spirit Week 2 with Nathan Tasker
item.title: The Fruit of the Spirit Week 2 with Nathan Tasker
item.description:
For the second and final week of The Fruit of the Spirit series, Raechel and Amanda are joined by Nathan Tasker, fellow Nashvillian and Director of Music, Liturgy, and Creative Arts at Christ Presbyterian Church. The three dig into what it looks like for the Holy Spirit to dwell in believers, wondering aloud at the richness of God’s character and the way Scripture continues to surprise and challenge us. The conversation begins at kindness, touches on youth group skits and laying bricks, and lands with a beautiful story from Nate that illustrates the importance of the Spirit’s presence in our daily lives.

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/the-fruit-of-the-spirit-week-2-with-nathan-tasker/

item.title: The Fruit of the Spirit Week 1 with Jessica Lamb
item.description:
For the first week of The Fruit of the Spirit series, Raechel and Amanda talk with She Reads Truth Editorial Director, Jessica Lamb. Together, they talk about how the simplest aspects of everyday life, from FIFA and fiddle-leaf figs to sunflowers and successful parenting, strengthen our understanding of the fruit of the Spirit. Join us this week as we correct our misconceptions about the fruit of the Spirit and find encouragement in what it means to produce fruit and become more like Christ.

item.itunes:title: Proverbs Week 4 with Angie Smith
item.title: Proverbs Week 4 with Angie Smith
item.description:
For the final week of our Proverbs series, Amanda and Raechel sit down with author, speaker, and fellow lover of God’s Word, Angie Smith. As the three talk about the wisdom that concerns our material world, they also touch on self-woven bedspreads and why you probably shouldn’t holler at strangers. Together, they explore the dangers of wealth, the surprising relationship between gluttony and generosity, and why even though walking in God’s wisdom looks different depending on the times and seasons, His Word will always be a faithful guide. Bonus points if you catch how many times they mention the word “tacos” or “self-governance”!

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 4 of the She Reads Truth Proverbs reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Proverbs collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/proverbs-week-4-with-angie-smith/

item.itunes:title: Proverbs Week 3 with Jackie Hill Perry
item.title: Proverbs Week 3 with Jackie Hill Perry
item.description:
It’s Week 3 of our Proverbs series, and Amanda and Raechel welcome author, poet, Bible teacher, and expectant mother Jackie Hill Perry to the podcast. They reminisce on grandmothers, sigh over the beauty of clean sheets, and Jackie even briefly sings a few bars of a popular tune to our hosts’ delight. The three dig into this week’s readings, tackling hard sayings and tough topics: what it really means to be a Proverbs 31 woman, adultery, and delighting in correction. No matter how challenging the passages may seem, they take comfort in this: all of God’s Word is good and profitable because it all helps us to know Him better. 

Show notes can be found here: shereadstruth.com/podcast/proverbs-week-3-with-jackie-hill-perry/

item.itunes:title: Proverbs Week 2 with Lore Wilbert
item.title: Proverbs Week 2 with Lore Wilbert
item.description:
For the second week of our Proverbs series, Raechel and Amanda talk with author, SRT devotional writer, and upstate New York’s newest resident, Lore Ferguson Wilbert. While studying proverbs focusing on the inner life, they talk about everything from Proverbs’ unique ability to be equally convicting, painful, and sweet, to the ideal temperature for a dark chocolate peanut butter cup. Together, they celebrate the truth that these proverbs repeatedly reveal: we serve a God whose work and power are far beyond our ability or understanding. When we recognize this, we too can live out the Wilbert family mantra—“fidelity to the Word of God and not to an outcome.” 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Proverbs: Walking in Wisdom reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 


Shop the Proverbs: Walking in Wisdom Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 


Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/proverbs-week-2-with-lore-wilbert/

item.itunes:title: Proverbs Week 1 with Russ Ramsey
item.title: Proverbs Week 1 with Russ Ramsey
item.description:
For the first week of our Proverbs series, Raechel and Amanda open their Bibles alongside pastor, author, and former SRT teammate, Russ Ramsey. As they explore the genre of wisdom literature, Russ explains how Proverbs is not a book of laws but a collection of wise sayings that are “generally true, always wise.” They chat about the significance of the Hebrew word for “happy,” how reading the Bible means the Bible reads us, and the loveliness of Nashville in autumn. The three friends celebrate these tiny morsels of portable theology and how the book of Proverbs teaches us to walk in God’s wisdom.  

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Proverbs reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Proverbs Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/proverbs-week-1-with-russ-ramsey/

item.itunes:title: Daniel Week 3 with Dr. J. Daniel Hays
item.title: Daniel Week 3 with Dr. J. Daniel Hays
item.description:
It’s the final week of our Daniel series, and Raechel and Amanda speak with author and Biblical Studies professor, Dr. J. Daniel Hays. Dr. Hays’s enthusiasm captivates our hosts, from his Babylon-themed virtual background to his fondness for the word schmutz. They discuss the bizarre visions of chapters 8–12, along with apocalyptic imagery and names that could double as tongue twisters (try saying Antiochus Epiphanes a few times). However perplexing these passages are, the three continue to identify this clear truth: God’s plans are unstoppable, and one day, we will see all prophecy from His Word fulfilled.

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Daniel reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

Shop the Daniel Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/daniel-week-3-with-dr-j-daniel-hays/

item.itunes:title: Daniel Week 2 with Jen Wilkin
item.title: Daniel Week 2 with Jen Wilkin
item.description:
For the second week of our Daniel series, Raechel and Amanda talk with author, Bible teacher, and biblical literacy advocate, Jen Wilkin. As they brave the book of Daniel, they continuously come back to one simple question that provides clarity and understanding for beginning Bible readers and biblical scholars alike. Whether reading familiar stories like Daniel in the lions’ den or wading through the often uncharted waters of biblical prophecy, they rejoice in the truth that Scripture is not only “for them and for then, but for us and for always.”

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Daniel reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Daniel Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Daniel Week 1 with Nancy Guthrie
item.title: Daniel Week 1 with Nancy Guthrie
item.description:
For the first week of our Daniel series, Raechel and Amanda sit down with author, speaker, and Bible teacher, Nancy Guthrie. In this introductory episode, the hosts read about Daniel’s captivity in Babylon and explain different genres of biblical literature. They chat about kings and kingdoms, dreams and divine deliverance, and why Nebeduchnezzar reminds Raechel of Prince Huperdinck from The Princess Bride. Together the three women explore what it looks like to live a life consecrated to the one true God and why it’s worth investing every moment of our lives in seeking God’s Word and His kingdom that lasts forever.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Daniel reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: The Presence of God Week 4 with Dr. J. Scott Duvall
item.title: The Presence of God Week 4 with Dr. J. Scott Duvall
item.description:
For the final week of The Presence of God series, Raechel and Amanda talk with Dr. J. Scott Duvall, author and New Testament professor at Ouachita Baptist University. Together they discuss the week’s Scripture readings, exploring the relationship between God’s presence and blessing, the beauty of corporate worship, and the difference between moralism and walking with Jesus. With the help of an unconventional circus metaphor, the three rejoice over the assurance of God’s presence and the peace He provides His people in the midair moments of life.

This episode corresponds to Week 4 of the She Reads Truth The Presence of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: The Presence of God Week 3 with Whitney Capps
item.title: The Presence of God Week 3 with Whitney Capps
item.description:
For the third week of The Presence of God series, Raechel and Amanda talk with Bible teacher, author, and Simple Seminary founder, Whitney Capps. As they venture through the week's reading together, the three friends marvel at the reality of God's presence, wrestle with some hard truths, and rejoice in the lightbulb moments that make Bible reading a constant adventure. Amid chats about the temple curtain and the importance of obedience over sacrifice, they remind one another that all of Scripture, even the parts that are tough to read or imagine, are written by God for His glory and our good.

Read with Us: This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth The Presence of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: The Presence of God Week 2 with Lisa Harper
item.title: The Presence of God Week 2 with Lisa Harper
item.description:
For the second week of our Presence of God series, Raechel and Amanda talk with author, speaker, and exuberant student of God’s Word, Lisa Harper. Their lively conversation covers topics like God’s footsteps in the garden, His manifest presence in the burning bush, His glory filling the temple, and His mercy planted right in the middle. Breezing past holy bouncers and Baywatch, the three friends celebrate how God makes His presence and redemption known in unmistakable ways. No matter how far we wander, He is always near. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth The Presence of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop The Presence of God Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/the-presence-of-god-week-2-with-lisa-harper/

item.itunes:title: The Presence of God Week 1 with Jessica Lamb
item.title: The Presence of God Week 1 with Jessica Lamb
item.description:
For the first week of our series on the Presence of God, Raechel and Amanda talk with SRT Editorial Director, Jessica Lamb, about the awe-inspiring reality that God pursues us and invites us into His presence. The three friends lay the foundation for this four-week study by defining key aspects of God’s presence, while also discussing nighttime basketball and disclosing who can still do a cartwheel. Wherever the conversation goes, it always comes back to this: God’s presence permeates our daily lives and the world around us.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth The Presence of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 


Shop the Presence of God Reading Plan collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Ephesians Week 3 with Trillia Newbell
item.title: Ephesians Week 3 with Trillia Newbell
item.description:
In this final week of our Ephesians series, Raechel and Amanda sit down with author, acquisitions editor, and auditory delight, Trillia Newbell. Reading through the last two chapters of Ephesians, the three women explore how the gospel reframes our relationships under the grace and authority of Christ. From Ephesus to the East Tennessee mountains, their questions and conversation point to the redeeming work of Jesus and the beautiful mystery of God’s kindness.

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Ephesians reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.title: Ephesians Week 2 with Rebecca Faires
item.description:
In this second week of our Ephesians series, Raechel and Amanda talk with friend, sister, and She Reads Truth writer, Rebecca Faires. Together they talk honestly about the power of confession, the beauty of God’s covenant family, and the unified calling of the Church. They reminisce about the early days of She Reads Truth, laugh about duck parades, and encourage the Shes and each other to double down on their commitment to knowing their Bibles in order to know what is true.

item.itunes:title: Ephesians Week 1 with Jennie Allen
item.title: Ephesians Week 1 with Jennie Allen
item.description:
For the first week of our Ephesians series, Raechel and Amanda talk with bestselling author and IF: Gathering visionary, Jennie Allen. While discussing adjectives, altar calls, and the apostle Paul’s affinity for run-on sentences, the women navigate nuanced theology and how to embrace the tension we find in Scripture. Together, they glory in the unity and steadfast hope that is ours in Christ when we seek the true prize of knowing Jesus.

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Ephesians reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Psalm 119 Week 2 with Christy Nockels
item.title: Psalm 119 Week 2 with Christy Nockels
item.description:
For the second and final week of our Psalm 119 series, Raechel and Amanda sit down with songwriter, author, and chicken mama, Christy Nockels. The women connect over their shared love for Psalm 119 and explore how the psalm is both a songbook for personal prayer and an invitation into God’s love. Touching on everything from alphabets and acrostics to bonfires and blueberries, they meditate on the unchanging truth of God’s Word and its profound ability to comfort us during times of joy and affliction. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Psalm 119: We Delight in Your Word reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Psalm 119: We Delight in Your Word collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Psalm 119 Week 1 with Kristie Anyabwile
item.title: Psalm 119 Week 1 with Kristie Anyabwile
item.description:
For the first week of our Psalm 119 series, Raechel and Amanda chat with author, Bible teacher, and lover of God’s Word, Kristie Anyabwile. The three have a “Psalm 119 party” as they discuss the structure and themes of this unique psalm and what it means to truly delight in God’s Word. Kristie also offers some great tips for Scripture memorization and provides us with the encouragement we need to start memorizing verses—or even whole books of the Bible! The three women consistently come back to one theme: God’s Word is for God’s people, and we are meant to delight in it. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Psalm 119: We Delight in Your Word reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com

Shop the Psalm 119: We Delight in Your Word collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Save 20% on your first Subscription Box when you use the code SUB20. July’s box will include our upcoming Ephesians Study Book.

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/psalm-119-week-1-with-kristie-anyabwile/
