item.itunes:title: Women & Men in The Word: New Testament Week 6 with Jefferson Bethke
item.title: Women & Men in The Word: New Testament Week 6 with Jefferson Bethke
item.description:
For the final week of our Women & Men in the Word: New Testament series, Raechel and Amanda sit down with author, speaker, YouTuber, and cheerleader of families, Jefferson Bethke. Together they discuss the stories of Cornelius, James, Priscilla & Aquila, Timothy, and Philemon & Onesimus. Their lively conversation covers covenants and power couples, faith and doubt, dinnertime antics, and the beautiful complexity of the body of Christ. Through Jesus, all are welcome to feast at God’s family table.

item.title: Women & Men in the Word: New Testament Week 3 with Jo Saxton
item.description:
For our third week in Women & Men in the Word: New Testament, Raechel and Amanda are joined by author, speaker, and leadership coach Jo Saxton. Together the three discuss the stories of Mary Magdalene, John, Bartimaeus, the rich young ruler, and Zacchaeus, and how their lives were transformed by Jesus. Along the way, they chat about their favorite Bible characters, the difference between American and English bacon, and what it means to be a woman who champions other women in their love for the Word.

For this week’s bonus episode, guest host and SRT creative director Jeremy Mitchell interviews Raechel and her husband, Ryan Myers—Chief Operations Officer—about She Reads Truth’s approach to design. item.title: Women & Men in The Word: New Testament Week 2 with Sadie Robertson Huff
item.description:
For our second week in Women & Men in the Word: New Testament, Raechel and Amanda are joined by author, speaker, podcaster, and lover of God’s Word—Sadie Robertson Huff. Together the three have a lively chat about the stories of Nicodemus, Peter, Jairus & his daughter, the woman at the well, and the boy with fishes & loaves, asking questions and finding connections to their own stories along the way. From cactus roots and late night talks, to miracles and moons, it’s clear that Jesus transforms lives not just in the New Testament, but here and now.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Women & Men in the Word: New Testament reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Women & Men in The Word: New Testament Week 1 with Jessica Lamb
item.title: Women & Men in The Word: New Testament Week 1 with Jessica Lamb
item.description:
To kick off our Women & Men in the Word: New Testament series, Raechel and Amanda are joined by returning guest and SRT team member, Jessica Lamb. Together, they take a long look at Jesus, as well as the stories of Elizabeth & Zechariah, Mary of Nazareth, John the Baptist, and Anna & Simeon. They discuss the importance of asking questions and wonder aloud what it must have been like to be Jesus’s mama or Zechariah’s son. Along the way, they manage to touch on the topics of fairytales, hammocks, Anne of Green Gables, and the sound of children laughing in the rain.

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Women & Men in the Word: New Testament reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Bonus Episode 1: The Tweet That Started SRT
item.title: Bonus Episode 1: The Tweet That Started SRT
item.description:
In celebration of our birthday month, Raechel and Amanda are joined by SRT creative director, Jeremy Mitchell. Together, the three journey all the way back to 2012 to tell the She Reads Truth origin story. Along the way, they discuss the tweet that started it all, the very first study book (it was stapled!), and why all these years later the She Reads Truth mission has stayed exactly the same. Whether you’ve been with us since day one, or you’re new to the She Reads Truth community, we hope this conversation invites you to join us in our mission of women and men in the Word of God every day.

item.itunes:title: Ecclesiastes Week 3 with Kelly Minter
item.title: Ecclesiastes Week 3 with Kelly Minter
item.description:
For the third and final episode in our Ecclesiastes series, Raechel and Amanda are joined by author, singer-songwriter, and friend of the SRT podcast, Kelly Minter. Chatting about everything from quarantine dogs to pink peonies, they wrestle with the book’s call to invest in this temporary life. What does it look like to find true meaning in God alone while also enjoying the gifts He gives us here “under the sun”? Kelly tells how one verse from Ecclesiastes changed her life, Raechel talks expiration dates, and Amanda tries out some new slang. And they all breathe a sigh of relief at Solomon’s hard-won conclusion. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Ecclesiastes reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Shop the Ecclesiastes collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Save 25% on the Women & Men in the Word: New Testament collection with the code WORD25.

Show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/ecclesiastes-week-3-with-kelly-minter/

item.itunes:title: Ecclesiastes Week 2 with Scott Sauls
item.title: Ecclesiastes Week 2 with Scott Sauls
item.description:
For week 2 of our Ecclesiastes study, Raechel and Amanda are joined by SRT podcast alum, pastor Scott Sauls. This week’s reading has a lot to say about money and wealth, so the group follows suit, tackling this tough-to-talk-about topic together. They discuss the relationship between wealth and loneliness, the necessity of community, and the freedom found in knowing we've always only had one Provider. Along the way, they also chat about porch proms in the time of COVID, the wonderful obliviousness of nature, and Scott’s favorite book of the Bible. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Ecclesiastes reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 


Shop the Ecclesiastes collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com. 

Save 25% on the Women & Men in the Word: New Testament collection with the code WORD25.

item.itunes:title: Ecclesiastes Week 1 with Dr. George Grant
item.title: Ecclesiastes Week 1 with Dr. George Grant
item.description:
In this episode of the She Reads Truth Podcast, Raechel and Amanda are joined by pastor, author, and long-time friend Dr. George Grant. Dr. Grant is a brilliant theologian and student of the Bible, and together the three take a look at King Solomon's tireless search to find meaning, as recorded in the book of Ecclesiastes. Life under the sun is wearisome and temporary, but when we put on our spiritual bifocals to view the world through a kingdom lens, we find lasting beauty and hope. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth Ecclesiastes reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Promises of God Week 3 with Ellie Holcomb
item.title: Promises of God Week 3 with Ellie Holcomb
item.description:
During this third and final week of our Promises of God series, Raechel and Amanda are joined by special guest Ellie Holcomb. Ellie is a prolific singer-songwriter, beloved children’s book author, and longtime friend of She Reads Truth, her music serving as SRT’s unofficial soundtrack over the years. Together, they talk about the “already and not yet” of God’s promises, the art of fighting fear with Truth, and what it looks like to choose feasting over famine. God’s promises are trustworthy—an anchor for our souls even amidst the unknown. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth Promises of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Promises of God Week 2 with Scarlet Hiltibidal
item.title: Promises of God Week 2 with Scarlet Hiltibidal
item.description:
It’s week two of She Reads Truth’s Promises of God study, and Raechel is joined by SRT’s managing editor, Jessica Lamb, and special guest, Scarlet Hiltibidal. Scarlet is a friend, author, and lover of Scripture, and she knows what it means to step out of fear and into the amazing promises of God. Together they talk about why planes don’t bounce, why it’s good to own chickens during a pandemic, and who draws the best Bible-margin praise hands. (Spoiler: It’s Amanda!) The promises Jesus made to all believers are sometimes shocking, but they are all beautiful, good, and true—and we need to hear them right now.

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Promises of God reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

Save 15% on your first Subscription Box when you use the code BOX15.

item.itunes:title: Promises of God Week 1 with John Greco
item.title: Promises of God Week 1 with John Greco
item.description:
We all want to stand on the promises of God, but how do we know which biblical promises are for us? And how do we begin to apply them to our lives? This week, we’re beginning a new reading plan: Promises of God—and we’re more than a little excited about it! It’s a topic that’s been on Raechel’s heart for years. On this episode, she and Amanda are joined by SRT’s content director, John Greco. Together, they talk about the making of this plan and Study Book, and how every promise of God finds its Yes in Christ.

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth 1, 2 & 3 John reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and  SheReadsTruth.com.

In this episode of the She Reads Truth Podcast, Raechel and Amanda are joined by SRT’s content director, John Greco, to begin a two-week series on the books of 1, 2, and 3 John. They talk about working from home with kids, the apostle John’s fascination with light, and what it might have felt like to be the last of the twelve disciples left standing. These letters remind us that no matter what’s taking place in our world, the love of God never changes.

item.title: Lent 2020 Week 6 with Russ Ramsey
item.description:
For week six of our Lent series, Raechel and Amanda are joined by author, pastor, and longtime friend Russ Ramsey! Russ pastors a congregation here in Nashville and is the author of The Passion of the King of Glory, a beautiful retelling of Jesus’s life, death, and resurrection. The conversation winds its way from the joys of adopting small children to the hope we find at the end of Jeremiah. Plus, Russ helps us prepare for Holy Week with a look at the events in real time.

item.itunes:title: Lent 2020 Week 4 with Lisa Harper
item.title: Lent 2020 Week 4 with Lisa Harper
item.description:
There’s no one quite like Bible teacher and author Lisa Harper. She joins Raechel and Amanda to dig deep into week four of our Lent reading plan. Together they talk about the soft, gooey center of the book of Jeremiah, what happens when suffering collides with joy, and why Christians ought to be Easter-people all year round.

item.title: Philippians Week 2 with Jess Connolly
item.description:
It’s the second week of the SRT Philippians reading plan, and Raechel and Amanda are joined by Jess Connolly! Jess is a mama, author, church planter, podcast host, and the founder of All Good Things Collective and Go + Tell Gals. She was also there for the beginning of She Reads Truth, one of the first to commit to being a “woman in the Word of God every day.” 

Jess opens up about the shape that obedience to God has taken in her life and the comfort she has found in Scripture. As Paul tells us in Philippians, we can have peace, regardless of our circumstances, as long as we have Christ.

item.title: Philippians Week 1 with John Greco
item.description:
Philippians - Week 1 |

Raechel, Amanda, and John are back together to dive into the first week of the SRT Philippians reading plan. They discuss how Paul's encouraging letter to the church at Philippi puts the upside-down nature of God's kingdom on full display: Suffering and joy go hand in hand, death has lost its sting, and every gain is counted as loss when compared to the blessing of knowing Christ. When Jesus takes hold of us, nothing is ever the same again!

item.itunes:title: Genesis Week 5 with Kelly Minter
item.title: Genesis Week 5 with Kelly Minter
item.description:
Raechel and Amanda are back with Kelly Minter to wrap up the last week of the SRT Genesis reading plan. They dive into the tumultuous story of Joseph, a man whose life proves suffering and blessing aren't mutually exclusive. From his heaven-born dreams to the depths of prison, all the way to the second highest office in Egypt, God was with Joseph. Kelly and our hosts talk about the power of God to bring goodness from the most trying of circumstances and the sort of faith that would make a dying man ask that his bones be buried in a distant land.


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 5 of the She Reads Truth Genesis: Back to the Beginning reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

It’s the fourth week of the SRT Genesis reading plan, and Raechel and Amanda sit down with the multi-talented Kelly Minter to go deep. With the stories of Rachel, Leah, Jacob, and Joseph open before them, they talk about jealousy and grace, wrestling with God, and waiting on the Lord’s perfect timing. Kelly opens up about the beauty that emerged from a decade of darkness in her life, and the trio discusses what it looks like to surrender our desires to the Lord.

item.title: Genesis Week 3 with Scott Sauls
item.description:
On this episode, Raechel and Amanda visit with Pastor Scott Sauls. They discuss the hard stories of Genesis, seeing glimpses of Christ throughout the Old Testament, and the comforting fact that there’s nothing we go through that Jesus hasn’t been through Himself. They explore what suffering teaches us about God, taking notes in Bibles, and why there’s nothing better than eye contact with a great dog.

item.description:
It’s the start of a new year, and She Reads Truth is going back to the beginning! On this episode of the podcast, Raechel and Amanda are joined by the She Reads Truth Content Director, John Greco, to talk about all things Genesis. They discuss the pressure of New Year’s resolutions and how our best intentions reveal the deepest longings of our hearts and ultimately point us back to the garden. Along the way, they grapple with the heaviness of sin, delight in the goodness of God’s heart, and debate the year-round use of twinkle lights.

item.title: Advent 2019 Week 4
item.description:
It’s Christmas week on the She Reads Truth podcast! In this episode, Raechel and Amanda are back with She Reads Truth content director, John Greco, for part two of “Stump John.” Did Mary suffer shame? Was it really a silent night? What did the manger actually look like, and what does Indiana Jones have to do with it? Raechel talks about babies, Amanda admits her affinity for the BeeGees, and John and his Christmas socks take us deeper into the good news and great joy of Christmas.

item.itunes:title: Advent 2019 Week 3
item.title: Advent 2019 Week 3
item.description:
On this episode of the She Reads Truth podcast, founders Raechel Myers and Amanda Bible Williams try to stump She Reads Truth content director, John Greco, with all their Christmas questions. When exactly was Jesus born? Was the “inn” really an inn? Were animals present? What about the wise men? How could Joseph and Mary afford to flee to Egypt? Why do we still have so many questions about a story we’ve known since we were kids? 

Armed with neon ski caps and cups of coffee, the trio ventures down these and other rabbit trails related to the Christmas story, asking, “What does Scripture actually say?” They find some answers and oddities along the way, and find, once again, that God’s Word only grows richer under the microscope of our honest questions. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 3 of the She Reads Truth A Thrill of Hope: Advent 2019 reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Advent 2019 Collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com 

Additional show notes can be found at shereadstruth.com/podcast/advent-2019-week-3/

item.itunes:title: Advent 2019 Week 2
item.title: Advent 2019 Week 2
item.description:
Our Advent series continues with a deep-dive on the mystery of Immanuel, “God with us.” She Reads Truth’s content director, John Greco, joins Raechel and Amanda as they trace the presence of God through the Bible, from Genesis to Revelation. What did God’s presence look like in the Old Testament? How does the Christmas story accomplish God’s mission of dwelling with His people? How is “God with us” our true and forever hope?

With a little help from their buddies Lewis, Spurgeon, and (Jimmy) Stewart, the trio explores the miracle of the incarnation, the glory of God’s presence, and the promise that we will dwell with the Lord forever. Amanda does some praise-handsing over Isaiah 41, John wonders where Cain and Abel brought their sacrifices, and Raechel can’t help but sing…just a little. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth A Thrill of Hope: Advent 2019 reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Advent 2019 Collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com 

Open Your Bibles: (passages referenced in this episode) 

Isaiah 7:14
Genesis 3
Genesis 4:1–7
Genesis 11:1–9
Deuteronomy 32:7–9
Genesis 12:1–3; 15:1–6; 17:15–19
Isaiah 41:17–20
Exodus 3
1 Kings 6
Exodus 25:40; Hebrews 8:5
Ezekiel 37:14
Exodus 34:29–35
Philippians 2:5–8
Revelation 21:1–5

Other Links: 

  • “The Eternal Being, who knows everything and who created the whole universe, became not only a man but (before that) a baby, and before that a foetus inside a woman’s body. If you want to get the hang of it, think how you would like to become a slug or a crab.” –C.S. Lewis, Mere Christianity(not The Screwtape Letters— oops!)
  • Elf
  • White Christmas
  • It’s a Wonderful Life
  • It’s a Wonderful (Copyright) Life 
  • A Charlie Brown Christmas
  • “He, who was from everlasting to everlasting, came to this world of time, and stood upon the narrow neck of land betwixt the two unbounded seas. ‘God with us:’ He has not lost that name....” –C.H. Spurgeon, “The Birth of Christ” sermon, 1854

Upcoming Reading Plans: 

Genesis: Back to the Beginning — plan begins 1/6/20

Socials: 

She Reads Truth on Instagram & Facebook
Raechel Myers on

item.itunes:title: Advent 2019 Week 1
item.title: Advent 2019 Week 1
item.description:
It’s beginning to sound a lot like Christmas in this long-awaited first Advent episode of the She Reads Truth podcast! Raechel and Amanda are joined by She Reads Truth’s content director, John Greco, as they step into the anticipation and celebration of the season. What is Advent? Why do we love it so much? What was it like to wait for the Messiah? Why did Jesus come? 

Clad in holiday shirts and socks, the group talks traditional Advent scriptures, favorite Christmas carols, and a little Charlie Brown and Linus too! John weaves a Scripture tapestry, Raechel stomps a dragon, and Amanda refuses to sing on-air—all while eagerly awaiting the arrival of Jesus, our Thrill of Hope.

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth A Thrill of Hope: Advent 2019 reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.content:encoded:
It’s beginning to sound a lot like Christmas in this long-awaited first Advent episode of the She Reads Truth podcast! Raechel and Amanda are joined by She Reads Truth’s content director, John Greco, as they step into the anticipation and celebration of the season. What is Advent? Why do we love it so much? What was it like to wait for the Messiah? Why did Jesus come? 

Clad in holiday shirts and socks, the group talks traditional Advent scriptures, favorite Christmas carols, and a little Charlie Brown and Linus too! John weaves a Scripture tapestry, Raechel stomps a dragon, and Amanda refuses to sing on-air—all while eagerly awaiting the arrival of Jesus, our Thrill of Hope. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 1 of the She Reads Truth A Thrill of Hope: Advent 2019 reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Advent 2019 Collection at ShopSheReadsTruth.com

item.itunes:title: Mourning and Dancing - Week 2
item.title: Mourning and Dancing - Week 2
item.description:
On this episode of the She Reads Truth podcast, founders Reachel Myers and Amanda Bible Williams, and She Reads Truth content director, John Greco, go in-depth about the tension of the “already and not yet” of the gospel. How do we find beauty in brokenness? How does God enter into our trials? How do we give thanks when we are suffering? 

Amanda, Raechel, and John talk about the first Thanksgiving and how the holiday has been a delicate dance of celebration and sorrow from the start. Amanda remembers what it felt like to give thanks while her 4-year-old son was on life support. And the group discusses the right-now and future hope we have in Jesus. 

Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to Week 2 of the She Reads Truth Mourning & Dancing reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com. 

Mourning & Dancing Study Book 

Open Your Bibles: (passages referenced in this episode) 

Matthew 9:14–17
John 14:18
Ecclesiastes 3:1–8
John 56:8
Acts 16:25
Revelation 21:3–5
Psalm 56:8
Colossians 1:13
John 6:68
Genesis 50:20
1 Thessalonians 5:16–18
John 16:20

Other Links: 

Who Was at the First Thanksgiving? (History.com article)
“You never know how much you really believe anything until its truth or falsehood becomes a matter of life and death to you. It is easy to say you believe a rope to be strong and sound as long as you are merely using it to cord a box. But suppose you had to hang by that rope over a precipice. Wouldn’t you then first discover how much you really trusted it?” ―C.S. Lewis, A Grief Observed
“No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.” —C.S. Lewis, A Grief Observed
“Fidelity to the Word of God and not to an outcome.” —Lore Ferguson Wilbert
Squanto and the Miracle of Thanksgiving by Eric Metaxas

item.itunes:title: Mourning and Dancing - Week 1
item.title: Mourning and Dancing - Week 1
item.description:
On this first-ever episode of the She Reads Truth podcast, founders Raechel Myers and Amanda Bible Williams go deep fast on topics of loss, grief, joy, and hope. How do celebration and sorrow coexist in the life of a believer? Does one cancel out the other? What does Scripture have to say about suffering? What does it mean to lament? Amanda reflects on her youngest son’s 11-month hospital stay, and Raechel shares about the role the Bible played in one of the darkest days of her life. The conversation isn’t light, but it’s good, honest, and hopeful. 


Read with Us: 

This episode corresponds to the She Reads Truth Mourning & Dancing reading plan found on the She Reads Truth app and SheReadsTruth.com.

item.itunes:title: Introducing the She Reads Truth Podcast
item.title: Introducing the She Reads Truth Podcast
item.description:
We know reading the Bible every day can be hard. It’s easy to feel stuck, lost, or unsure where to start. We get it. We’ve been there too. 

Here at She Reads Truth and He Reads Truth, we create beautiful, accessible Bible reading plans that guide hundreds of thousands of women and men around the world in reading God’s Word together every day. It’s okay to feel stuck—but you don’t have to stay stuck. 

We can help you develop daily Bible reading habits in your right-now, everyday life. Simply show up, read today’s scriptures with us, and do it again tomorrow. You’ll be amazed what a difference regular Bible reading makes. 

Our hope for this podcast is that it will serve as a complement to our reading plans, to encourage you on your commute to work, while you’re out for a walk, or at home making dinner. God’s Word is for you and for now. That's why our community is here and always open to you.
